p: Although many science educators agree on the importance of science communication, their biggest obstacle may be finding an audience outside of the classroom. Collaboration between researchers on a project is common. However, apart from public health initiatives, collaboration to communicate basic, up-to-date science principles is often restricted to partnerships between institutions of higher learning and local Kâ€“12 schools. The purpose of this article is to describe a recent collaboration between a museum and an interdisciplinary team of researchers, and to offer insights into both the process and the lessons learned.
